[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Dome of Stars.jpg|thumb|250px|The Dome of Stars in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
The '''Dome of Stars''' was a great domed hall in the city [[Osgiliath]],<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Dome of Stars'', p. 694</ref> the capital of [[Gondor]], where the chief ''[[palantíri|palantír]]'', the [[Master Stone of Osgiliath]] was kept.<ref>{{TT|Palantir}}, p. 598</ref>

The '''Tower of the Dome of Osgiliath''' was destroyed during the civil war of the [[Kin-strife]] in the [[Burning of Osgiliath|siege and Burning]] of Osgiliath and the palantír was lost in the river [[Anduin]]<ref>{{App|Gondor}}, entry for king Eldacar, p. 1046</ref> in {{TA|1437}}.<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 1437, p. 1086</ref><ref>{{UT|14a}}, note 3</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2015: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The Dome of Stars stands in the northern section of the city. After [[Sauron's attack on Osgiliath]] in [[Third Age 3018|T.A. 3018]], his forces threw down the bridge leading to the Dome of Stars from the west, transforming it into their stronghold. Later during the [[War of the Ring]], the Dome serves as perch for one of the [[Nazgûl]] whom the players confront in the palantír chamber during a group instance. After the [[Morgul-host]] moves over to the [[Pelennor Fields]], some of the [[Rangers of Ithilien]] who remained in hiding inside the city's culverts and became cut off from the rest of [[Gondor]]'s forces, sneak into the Dome of Stars and observe the [[battle of the Pelennor Fields]] from its top.
